Name: Azure DB - Execute SQL
Description:
Runs a sql command against an azure db. Will be open a port on the firewall to run the cmd and then close it when finished.

*depends on az cli*

*Depends on powershell sqlmodule *

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.azAccount
Parameters.Label: Azure Account
Parameters.HelpText: An Azure account with permissions to the subscription and the sql server being targeted

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.resourceGroupName
Parameters.Label: Resource Group Name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the resource group hosting the sql server

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.ServerName
Parameters.Label: SQL Server Name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the sql server. The FQDN (`database.windows.net`) will automatically be appended to this when needed.

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.dbName
Parameters.Label: Database Name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the database to execute the sql command against

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.AuthType
Parameters.Label: SQL Server Authentication Type
Parameters.HelpText: The type of authentication to use when connecting.

DisplaySettings.Octopus.SelectOptions:
sql|SQL Authentication
adPwd|Active Directory Password
ad|Active Directory Integration

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.userId
Parameters.Label: User Id
Parameters.HelpText: The user id to use when authenticating with the sql server

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.userPwd
Parameters.Label: User Password
Parameters.HelpText: Used with SQL or Active directory Password authentication.

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.connectionTimeout
Parameters.Label: Connection Timeout
Parameters.HelpText: The timeout for the query measured in seconds between 0 and 65534

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.retainResults
Parameters.Label: Retain Results
Parameters.HelpText: The results file is saved for future analysis and readability

Parameters.Name: azDbSqlCmd.saveDbInfo
Parameters.Label: Save Database Info
Parameters.HelpText: When enabled, the database and server name will be included at the bottom of the file along with sql script ran.
